intro: Hicorius pallida var. apposita, commonly known as the pale chicory variant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its pale blue to white flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical features make it a notable species for its ornamental value and ecological role in its native environment.
